CatDescriptText: Clifton Poinsette, maintenance man, 631 Hollace Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 7, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the Wacs and others women's units, with the exception of nurses, should be abolished in armed services during peacetime? Why?" answer reads: "I think that they are of importance in the doing the office work and thus allowing more men to be prepared to do the actual fighting or manning boats or whatever the duty may be which they would be kept from doing because of office work."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Clifton Poinsette wearing zippered jacket with collar, moustache, and cap, standing in front of Fanny Farmer candy store, with Dimlings candy store in background, Wood Street, Downtown
